If set to true, disable the deprecated parameters 'single_file' and 
    'non_empty' on attribute definition methods, such as attr.label().

name: distdir
description:
Additional places to search for archives before accessing the network to 
    download them.

name: custom_malloc
description:
Specifies a custom malloc implementation. This setting overrides malloc 
    attributes in build rules.

name: expand_test_suites
description:
Expand test_suite targets into their constituent tests before analysis. 
    When this flag is turned on (the default), negative target patterns will 
    apply to the tests belonging to the test suite, otherwise they will not. 
    Turning off this flag is useful when top-level aspects are applied at 
    command line: then they can analyze test_suite targets.

name: proto_toolchain_for_javalite
description:
Label of proto_lang_toolchain() which describes how to compile JavaLite 
    protos

name: test_timeout_filters
type: comma-separated list of values: short, moderate, long or eternal
description: Specifies a comma-separated list of test timeouts. Each timeout can be optionally preceded with '-' to specify excluded timeouts. Only those test targets will be found that contain at least one included timeout and do not contain any excluded timeouts. This option affects --build_tests_only behavior and the test command.

name: incompatible_new_actions_api
description:
If set to true, the API to create actions is only available on `ctx.
    actions`, not on `ctx`.

name: extra_entitlements
description:
Location of a .entitlements file that is merged into any iOS signing action 
    in this build.

name: use_singlejar_apkbuilder
description: Build Android APKs with SingleJar.

name: test_filter
description: Specifies a filter to forward to the test framework.  Used to limit the tests run. Note that this does not affect which targets are built.

name: coverage_report_generator
description:
Location of the binary that is used to generate coverage reports. This must 
    currently be a filegroup that contains a single file, the binary. Defaults 
    to '//tools/test:coverage_report_generator'.

name: force_experimental_external_repositories
description: Forces --experimental_external_repositories.

name: loading_phase_threads
description:
Number of parallel threads to use for the loading/analysis phase. "auto" 
    means to use a reasonable value derived from the machine's hardware profile 
    (e.g. the number of processors).

name: host_platform
description: The label of a platform rule that describes the host system.

name: android_dynamic_mode
description:
Determines whether C++ deps of Android rules will be linked dynamically 
    when a cc_binary does not explicitly create a shared library. 'default' 
    means bazel will choose whether to link dynamically.  'fully' means all 
    libraries will be linked dynamically. 'off' means that all libraries will 
    be linked in mostly static mode.

name: host_compilation_mode
description:
Specify the mode the tools used during the build will be built in. Values: 
    'fastbuild', 'dbg', 'opt'.

name: experimental_check_desugar_deps
description: Whether to double-check correct desugaring at Android binary level.

name: incompatible_no_output_attr_default
description:
If set to true, disables the `default` parameter of the `attr.output` and 
    `attr.output_list` attribute definition functions.

name: html_histograms
description:
If --html_histograms and --html_details is present, the HTML output will 
    display histograms for Skylark functions clicked in the statistics table. 
    This will increase file size massively.

name: experimental_disable_compilation_mode_flags
description:
If true, Bazel will not read crosstool flags from compilation_mode_flags 
    field.

name: cc_proto_library_source_suffixes
description: Sets the prefixes of source files that a cc_proto_library creates.

name: fdo_profile
description: The fdo_profile representing the profile to be used for optimization.

name: ios_simulator_device
description:
The device to simulate when running an iOS application in the simulator, e.
    g. 'iPhone 6'. You can get a list of devices by running 'xcrun simctl list 
    devicetypes' on the machine the simulator will be run on.

name: experimental_action_listener
description: Use action_listener to attach an extra_action to existing build actions.

name: ios_multi_cpus
description:
Comma-separated list of architectures to build an ios_application with. The 
    result is a universal binary containing all specified architectures.

name: macos_cpus
description:
Comma-separated list of architectures for which to build Apple macOS 
    binaries.

name: run_under
description:
Prefix to insert in front of command before running. Examples:
    	--run_under=valgrind
    	--run_under=strace
    	--run_under='strace -c'
    	--run_under='valgrind --quiet --num-callers=20'
    	--run_under=//package:target
    	--run_under='//package:target --options'

name: start
description:
How the app should be started after installing it. Set to WARM to preserve 
    and restore application state on incremental installs.

name: host_force_python
type: py2, py3, py2and3, py2only or py3only
description:
Overrides default_python_version attribute for the host configuration. Can 
    be "PY2" or "PY3".

name: experimental_remote_retry_start_delay_millis
description: The initial delay before retrying a transient error.

name: test_size_filters
type: comma-separated list of values: small, medium, large or enormous
description: Specifies a comma-separated list of test sizes. Each size can be optionally preceded with '-' to specify excluded sizes. Only those test targets will be found that contain at least one included size and do not contain any excluded sizes. This option affects --build_tests_only behavior and the test command.

name: experimental_objc_fastbuild_options
description: Uses these strings as objc fastbuild compiler options.

name: host_platform_remote_properties_override
description: Manually set the remote_execution_properties for the host platform if it is not already set.

name: local_test_jobs
description: The max number of local test jobs to run concurrently. 0 means local resources will limit the number of local test jobs to run concurrently instead. Setting this greater than the value for --jobs is ineffectual.

name: experimental_strict_fileset_output
description:
If this option is enabled, filesets will treat all output artifacts as 
    regular files. They will not traverse directories or be sensitive to 
    symlinks.

name: include_commandline
description:
Includes the content of the action command lines in the output (potentially 
    large).

name: experimental_remote_spawn_cache
description:
Whether to use the experimental spawn cache infrastructure for remote 
    caching. Enabling this flag makes Bazel ignore any setting for 
    remote_executor.

name: worker_verbose
description: If enabled, prints verbose messages when workers are started, shutdown, ...

name: experimental_analysis_testing_improvements
description:
If true, enables pieces of experimental Starlark API for analysis-phase 
    testing.

name: python2_path
description:
Local path to the Python2 executable. Deprecated, please use python_path or 
    python_top instead.

name: remote_cache
description: HOST or HOST:PORT of a remote caching endpoint.

name: build_python_zip
description: Build python executable zip; on on Windows, off on other platforms

name: experimental_android_databinding_v2
description: Use android databinding v2

name: show_result
description:
Show the results of the build.  For each target, state whether or not it 
    was brought up-to-date, and if so, a list of output files that were built.  
    The printed files are convenient strings for copy+pasting to the shell, to 
    execute them.
    This option requires an integer argument, which is the threshold number of 
    targets above which result information is not printed. Thus zero causes 
    suppression of the message and MAX_INT causes printing of the result to 
    occur always.  The default is one.

name: host_java_launcher
description: The Java launcher used by tools that are executed during a build.

name: query_file
description:
If set, query will read the query from the file named here, rather than on 
    the command line. It is an error to specify a file here as well as a 
    command-line query.

name: all_incompatible_changes
description:
Enables all options of the form --incompatible_*. Use this option to find 
    places where your build may break in the future due to deprecations or 
    other changes.
      Expands to: --incompatible_bzl_disallow_load_after_statement --
      incompatible_depset_is_not_iterable --incompatible_depset_union --
      incompatible_disable_deprecated_attr_params --
      incompatible_disable_objc_provider_resources --
      incompatible_disallow_conflicting_providers --
      incompatible_disallow_data_transition --incompatible_disallow_dict_plus --
      incompatible_disallow_filetype --incompatible_disallow_legacy_javainfo --
      incompatible_disallow_load_labels_to_cross_package_boundaries --
      incompatible_disallow_old_style_args_add --
      incompatible_disallow_slash_operator --incompatible_expand_directories --
      incompatible_generate_javacommon_source_jar --
      incompatible_new_actions_api --incompatible_no_attr_license --
      incompatible_no_output_attr_default --
      incompatible_no_support_tools_in_action_inputs --
      incompatible_no_target_output_group --incompatible_no_transitive_loads --
      incompatible_package_name_is_a_function --incompatible_range_type --
      incompatible_remove_native_git_repository --
      incompatible_remove_native_http_archive --
      incompatible_static_name_resolution --incompatible_string_is_not_iterable

name: embed_label
description: Embed source control revision or release label in binary

name: strict_proto_deps
type: off, warn, error, strict or default
description:
If true, checks that a proto_library target explicitly declares all 
    directly used targets as dependencies.

name: runs_per_test_detects_flakes
description: If true, any shard in which at least one run/attempt passes and at least one run/attempt fails gets a FLAKY status.

name: adb_arg
description:
Extra arguments to pass to adb. Usually used to designate a device to 
    install to.

name: order_output
description:
Output the results unordered (no), dependency-ordered (deps), or fully 
    ordered (full). The default is 'auto', meaning that results are output 
    either dependency-ordered or fully ordered, depending on the output 
    formatter (dependency-ordered for proto, minrank, maxrank, and graph, fully 
    ordered for all others). When output is fully ordered, nodes that would 
    otherwise be unordered by the output formatter are alphabetized before 
    output.

name: incompatible_disallow_data_transition
description: If set to true, rule attributes cannot set 'cfg = "data"', which is a noop.

name: incompatible_remove_native_http_archive
description:
If set to true, the native http_archive rules are disabled; only the 
    Starlark version will be available

name: grte_top
description:
A label to a checked-in libc library. The default value is selected by the 
    crosstool toolchain, and you almost never need to override it.

name: experimental_guard_against_concurrent_changes
description: Turn this off to disable checking the ctime of input files of an action before uploading it to a remote cache. There may be cases where the Linux kernel delays writing of files, which could cause false positives.

name: experimental_android_compress_java_resources
description: Compress Java resources in APKs

name: message_translations
description: The message translations used for translating messages in Java targets.

name: experimental_platforms_api
description:
If set to true, enables a number of platform-related Starlark APIs useful 
    for debugging.

name: action_graph:include_cmdline
description:
Include command line of actions in the action graph dump. This option does 
    only apply to --action_graph.

name: experimental_docker_privileged
description:
If enabled, Bazel will pass the --privileged flag to 'docker run' when 
    running actions. This might be required by your build, but it might also 
    result in reduced hermeticity.

name: experimental_disable_legacy_crosstool_fields
description:
If true, Bazel will not read crosstool flags from legacy crosstool fields 
    (see #5187).

name: java_header_compilation
description: Compile ijars directly from source.

name: worker_max_instances
description: How many instances of a worker process (like the persistent Java compiler) may be launched if you use the 'worker' strategy. May be specified as [name=value] to give a different value per worker mnemonic.

name: incompatible_range_type
description: If set to true, range() will use the 'range' type instead of 'list'.

name: logging
description: The logging level.

name: experimental_import_deps_checking
description:
When enabled, check whether the dependencies of an aar_import are complete. 
    This enforcement can break the build, or can just result in warnings.

name: experimental_sandbox_default_allow_network
description: Allow network access by default for actions.

name: remote_cache_proxy
description: Connect to the remote cache through a proxy. Currently this flag can only be used to configure a Unix domain socket (unix:/path/to/socket) for the HTTP cache.

name: show_task_finish
description: Display progress messages when tasks complete, not just when they start.

name: experimental_repository_cache_hardlinks
description:
If set, the repository cache will hardlink the file in case of a cache hit, 
    rather than copying. This is inteded to save disk space.

name: experimental_inmemory_dotd_files
description:
If enabled, C++ .d files will be passed through in memory directly from the 
    remote build nodes instead of being written to disk.

name: java_deps
description: Generate dependency information (for now, compile-time classpath) per Java target.

name: test_strategy
description: Specifies which strategy to use when running tests.

name: experimental_sandboxfs_path
description: Path to the sandboxfs binary to use when --experimental_use_sandboxfs is true. If a bare name, use the first binary of that name found in the PATH.

name: per_file_copt
type: comma-separated list of regex expressions with prefix '-' specifying excluded paths followed by an @ and a comma separated list of options
description:
Additional options to selectively pass to gcc when compiling certain files. 
    This option can be passed multiple times. Syntax: regex_filter@option_1,
    option_2,...,option_n. Where regex_filter stands for a list of include and 
    exclude regular expression patterns (Also see --instrumentation_filter). 
    option_1 to option_n stand for arbitrary command line options. If an option 
    contains a comma it has to be quoted with a backslash. Options can contain 
    @. Only the first @ is used to split the string. Example: --
    per_file_copt=//foo/.*\.cc,-//foo/bar\.cc@-O0 adds the -O0 command line 
    option to the gcc command line of all cc files in //foo/ except bar.cc.

name: java_classpath
description: Enables reduced classpaths for Java compilations.

name: rule_classes
description: Dump rule classes.

name: graph:node_limit
description:
The maximum length of the label string for a graph node in the output.  
    Longer labels will be truncated; -1 means no truncation.  This option is 
    only applicable to --output=graph.

name: apk_signing_method
description: Implementation to use to sign APKs

name: test_sharding_strategy
description: Specify strategy for test sharding: 'explicit' to only use sharding if the 'shard_count' BUILD attribute is present. 'disabled' to never use test sharding. 'experimental_heuristic' to enable sharding on remotely executed tests without an explicit  'shard_count' attribute which link in a supported framework. Considered experimental.

name: packages
description: Dump package cache content.

name: device
description:
The adb device serial number. If not specified, the first device will be 
    used.

name: experimental_oom_more_eagerly
description:
If set, attempt to detect Java heap OOM conditions and exit before 
    thrashing. Only honored when --batch is also passed. In some cases, builds 
    that previously succeeded may OOM if they were close to OOMing before. 
    Deprecated: Use the command argument --
    experimental_oom_more_eagerly_threshold instead.

name: experimental_profile_cpu_usage
description: If set, Bazel will measure cpu usage and add it to the JSON profile.

name: proto_toolchain_for_cc
description: Label of proto_lang_toolchain() which describes how to compile C++ protos

name: host_crosstool_top
description:
By default, the --crosstool_top and --compiler options are also used for 
    the host configuration. If this flag is provided, Bazel uses the default 
    libc and compiler for the given crosstool_top.

name: host_cpu
description: The host CPU.

name: workspace_rc
description: Whether or not to look for the workspace bazelrc file at $workspace/.bazelrc

name: bes_timeout
description:
Specifies how long bazel should wait for the BES/BEP upload to complete 
    after the build and tests have finished. A valid timeout is a natural 
    number followed by a unit: Days (d), hours (h), minutes (m), seconds (s), 
    and milliseconds (ms). The default value is '0' which means that there is 
    no timeout.

name: html_details
description:
If --html_details is present, the task diagram contains all tasks of the 
    profile  and performance statistics on user-defined and built-in Skylark 
    functions. If --nohtml_details is present, an aggregated diagram is 
    generated. The default is to generate an aggregated diagram.

name: swiftcopt
description: Additional options to pass to Swift compilation.

name: coverage_support
description:
Location of support files that are required on the inputs of every test 
    action that collects code coverage. Defaults to '//tools/test:
    coverage_support'.

name: canonicalize_policy
description:
Output the canonical policy, after expansion and filtering. To keep the 
    output clean, the canonicalized command arguments will NOT be shown when 
    this option is set to true. Note that the command specified by --
    for_command affects the filtered policy, and if none is specified, the 
    default command is 'build'.

name: mode
description:
Select how to run mobile-install. "classic" runs the current version of 
    mobile-install. "skylark" uses the new skylark version, which has support 
    for android_test.

name: xml:line_numbers
description:
If true, XML output contains line numbers. Disabling this option may make 
    diffs easier to read.  This option is only applicable to --output=xml.

name: experimental_remote_retry_multiplier
description: The multiplier by which to increase the retry delay on transient errors.

name: proto_toolchain_for_java
description: Label of proto_lang_toolchain() which describes how to compile Java protos

name: remote_timeout
description: The maximum number of seconds to wait for remote execution and cache calls.

name: verbose_explanations
description:
Increases the verbosity of the explanations issued if --explain is enabled. 
    Has no effect if --explain is not enabled.

name: experimental_execution_log_file
description: Log the executed spawns into this file as delimited Spawn protos.

name: spawn_strategy
description: Specify how spawn actions are executed by default. 'standalone' means run all of them locally without any kind of sandboxing. 'sandboxed' means to run them in a sandboxed environment with limited privileges (details depend on platform support).

name: experimental_ui_deduplicate
description:
Make the experimental UI deduplicate messages to have a cleaner scroll-back 
    log.

name: legacy_whole_archive
description:
When on, use --whole-archive for cc_binary rules that have linkshared=1 and 
    either linkstatic=1 or '-static' in linkopts. This is for backwards 
    compatibility only. A better alternative is to use alwayslink=1 where 
    required.

name: ltobackendopt
description:
Additional option to pass to the LTO backend step (under --
    features=thin_lto).

name: proto:default_values
description:
If true, attributes whose value is not explicitly specified in the BUILD 
    file are included; otherwise they are omitted. This option is applicable to 
    --output=proto

name: parse_headers_verifies_modules
description:
If enabled, the parse_headers feature verifies that a header module can be 
    built for the target in question instead of doing a separate compile of the 
    header.

name: experimental_remote_grpc_log
description: If specified, a path to a file to log gRPC call related details. This log consists of a sequence of serialized com.google.devtools.build.lib.remote.logging.RemoteExecutionLog.LogEntry protobufs with each message prefixed by a varint denoting the size of the following serialized protobuf message, as performed by the method LogEntry.writeDelimitedTo(OutputStream).
